metadata.title: USN-3425-1 -- Apache HTTP Server vulnerability
metadata.description: Hanno BÃ¶ck discovered that the Apache HTTP Server incorrectly handled Limit directives in .htaccess files. In certain configurations, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to read arbitrary server memory, including sensitive information. This issue is known as Optionsbleed.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3425-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.5 apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.5 apache2-dev - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.5 apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.5 apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.5 apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.5 apache2-doc - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.5 apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.5 No subscription required
